text: Looking for a self-contained equation rendering library
Is there such a thing as a small, self-contained library that will render an equation written in a text-based format (e.g.
LaTeX or MathML) to an image (either vector or raster)?
It would be preferable if it's in Python or Python-friendly.
(One possibility that I've found: Matplotlib has Python code to parse and display LaTeX equations, using gl2ps.
If I don't find anything else it seems possible to extract all the relevant bits into a separate library.
EDIT: by "self-contained" I mean they can't use TeX/LaTex itself since unfortunately I can't rely on it being installed
